DOC.brief_title: Health Education Intervention Reducing Weight Gain Patients With Newly Diagnosed Stage I-IV Breast Cancer Undergoing Chemotherapy
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine feasibility conduct weight maintenance intervention , term recruit retain participant . II . To obtain preliminary data effectiveness intervention prevent weight gain body composition , self-efficacy , perceive stress , fatigue , depression , exercise capacity , health-related quality life ( HRQL ) . Changes physical activity dietary intake also monitor . III . To determine weight control protocol require refinement use randomize controlled trial . IV . To determine many participant opt enroll short-term healthy lifestyle program completion final testing visit . OUTLINE : Participants undergo four 30-60 minute health education session 3 follow-up phone session interventionist trained behavioral science , physical activity nutrition , positive psychology 12 month . EDUCATION SESSION I : Participants receive information interventionist concern healthy diet choice exercise begin keep food log . EDUCATION SESSION II : Interventionists review information session I patient food log . Participants receive recommendation exercise set activity goal . EDUCATION SESSION III : Participants receive information determine portion size importance strength training building lean muscle mass . EDUCATION SESSION IV : Interventionists review information previous 3 session discuss importance planning goal set participant . The interventionist also discuss physical mental barrier exercise . After completion education session , patient receive 3 phone call time convenient patient answer question information learn previous educational session . After completion study , participant follow 12 month .
